statdoc.tasks.stata

Class StataUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • statdoc.tasks.stata.StataUtils

  • public class StataUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    general utils to deal with Stata in particular this class allows to convert smcl into various formats like txt and html. Futhermore it allows tokenising of Stata specific Strings
    Author:
    Markus Schaffner

    • Method Detail

      • getPatternMap

        static java.util.Map<java.util.regex.Pattern,java.lang.String> getPatternMap()

      • smcl2hidden

        public static java.lang.String smcl2hidden(java.lang.String content,
                           boolean ignoreCommands)
        utility method to replace scml commands with their hidden counterparts
        Parameters:
        content - A smcl string
        ignoreCommands - a boolean whether to process the commands given or not
        Returns:
        the smcl string with all formating replaced by hidden tokens (M0,M1,M2,M3)

      • smcl2html

        public static java.lang.String smcl2html(java.lang.String content,
                         boolean hideCommands)
        a utility method to replace smcl formating with html tags will use smcl2hidden as a workhorse
        Parameters:
        content - the smcl string
        hideCommands - boolean of whether to process command lines
        Returns:
        a html formated string

      • smcl2plain

        public static java.lang.String smcl2plain(java.lang.String content,
                          boolean hideCommands)
        a utility method to replace smcl formating uses smcl2hidden as a workhorse
        Parameters:
        content - the smcl string
        hideCommands - boolean of whether to process command lines
        Returns:
        plain txt string

      • splitSave

        public static java.lang.String[] splitSave(java.lang.String str,
                           java.lang.String splt)
        splits a Stata string into two with the last encounter of the split token makes sure that round and square brackets are balanced on either side of the split i.e. does not split within brackets
        Parameters:
        str - String to split
        splt - split marker
        Returns:
        an array of one or two elements

      • countChar

        public static int countChar(java.lang.String string,
            java.lang.String c)

      • balanceChars

        public static int balanceChars(java.lang.String string,
               java.lang.String c,
               java.lang.String d)
        returns the balance of two types of chars, used to match brackets
        Parameters:
        string - string of interest
        c - opening bracket character
        d - closing bracket character
        Returns:
        the difference between number of chars c-d
